item.title: Redd Art: Real or Fake – A Visual Guide
item.dc:creator: Matt
item.description: One of the categories for Animal Crossing: New Horizons’ museum is art. This art can be obtained by buying them from Redd, but only genuine art can go in the museum. The following will help you identify which art is real and which art is fake. We’ll also give you a link to information on […]
item.content:encoded:
One of the categories for Animal Crossing: New Horizons’ museum is art. This art can be obtained by buying them from Redd, but only genuine art can go in the museum. The following will help you identify which art is real and which art is fake. We’ll also give you a link to information on the real image that they are based on.

How Does Art Work in AC:NH?

Redd can be found rarely on your island. He will sell his art from inside his boat parked on your small northern beach. He will have four pieces of art for sale and two pieces of furniture. The art has a chance to be the real version or a fake version. There is a chance that none of the art is real and also that multiple are real.

The fake art cannot be donated to the museum or sold, so it’s important to pick the real pieces as there are a lot to collect and Redd doesn’t show up often. All art is based on a real life work of art, and the genuine art will look just like the art does in real life. The fake pieces will have subtle changes from the original that may be hard to notice if you don’t know what you’re looking for.
